intro: Paepalanthus weddellianus, commonly known as the Weddellian bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense clusters of small, white flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with succulent stems that store water. Its flowers bloom in the spring and are pollinated primarily by insects. Paepalanthus weddellianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
